meanings.definition: Having many crags or rugged features.
meanings.sent1: The mountain was craggier than the smooth valley below.
meanings.sent2: The rocks by the shore were craggier than the ones in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The craggier path seemed to challenge the hikers to a rocky dance.
meanings.sent4: His craggier voice echoed through the canyon of the auditorium.
meanings.sent5: The craggier terrain made it difficult for the explorers to navigate.

meanings.definition: More craggy in appearance than something else.
meanings.sent1: Her craggier painting stood out among the smooth landscapes.
meanings.sent2: The old castle looked craggier next to the modern skyscraper.
meanings.sent3: The craggier clouds seemed to play hide and seek with the sun.
meanings.sent4: His craggier expression revealed years of wisdom and experience.
meanings.sent5: The craggier cliffs loomed over the crashing waves below.
